abstract: The name of the queue that Game Center places the match request in.
overview:
## Discussion

To use matchmaking rules, set the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchRequest/queueName] property to a queue name that you configure in App Store Connect. Then set [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchRequest/properties] and optionally [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchRequest/recipientProperties] to game-specific criteria.

A *queue name* is a uniform type identifier (UTI) that contains only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphens (-), or periods (.). The string should be in reverse-DNS format. Queue names are case sensitive.

Matchmaking rules evaluate the properties of match requests in the same queue to find the best match according to the rules that you set in App Store Connect for the queue. An error occurs if the queue doesn’t exist.

If this property is `nil`, Game Center doesn’t use matchmaking rules to find other players.

For more information, see [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/matchmaking-rules].

# queueName

**Instance Property**

The name of the queue that Game Center places the match request in.

## Declaration

```swift
var queueName: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

To use matchmaking rules, set the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchRequest/queueName] property to a queue name that you configure in App Store Connect. Then set [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchRequest/properties] and optionally [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchRequest/recipientProperties] to game-specific criteria.

A *queue name* is a uniform type identifier (UTI) that contains only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphens (-), or periods (.). The string should be in reverse-DNS format. Queue names are case sensitive.

Matchmaking rules evaluate the properties of match requests in the same queue to find the best match according to the rules that you set in App Store Connect for the queue. An error occurs if the queue doesn’t exist.

If this property is `nil`, Game Center doesn’t use matchmaking rules to find other players.

For more information, see [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/matchmaking-rules].

## Related Documentation

- **Create a queue**: Create a queue and add it to a rule set.

## Matching players using rules

- **properties**: The criteria for the local player that Game Center uses to find other players when using matchmaking rules.
- **recipientProperties**: The criteria for recipients of the match request that Game Center uses to find other players when using matchmaking rules.
